headline: Tesla Stations at Airbnb Locations
author: In Transit
leadparagraph: Airbnb and Tesla Motors are starting a partnership to bring Tesla car charging stations to 30 Airbnb properties along the West Coast in cities such as Los Angeles, Palm Springs and Healdsburg, Calif. Tesla has donated and installed the stations that are meant to give travelers freedom on their road trips, according to Chip Conley, head of global hospitality and strategy at Airbnb. “When considering accommodations, Tesla drivers are limited by how far they can get on their car’s battery charge, but this partnership alleviates that constraint,” he said.

headline: Greece’s Market Reopens, European Banks Report Results, and Tesla Announces Earnings
author: The Week Ahead
leadparagraph: The Athens Stock Exchange reopened on Monday after a five-week closure that followed a decision by the Greek authorities to shut Greek banks and impose capital controls. The banks reopened two weeks ago, though restrictions on cash transactions remain in place to avert a run on the banks’ deposits. To prevent capital flight, a mass sell-off of holdings and a market crash, there is a cap on stock fluctuations and restrictions on local traders, though foreign investors will face no constraints when stock trading resumes. The reopening of Greece’s market comes as government officials and representatives of the country’s international creditors enter a second week of difficult negotiations on a multibillion-euro bailout, Greece’s third in five years. —Niki Kitsantonis
